headline: Exclusive-Morgan Stanley raising about $680 million for Japan real estate fund, sources say
summary: TOKYO (Reuters) -Morgan Stanley is raising about 100 billion yen ($684 million) for a Japan-focused real estate fund, two people familiar with the matter said, highlighting investor interest in property as the world's fourth-largest economy emerges from years of deflation and standstill prices.  The Morgan Stanley-managed fund is due to close in June and expected to raise at least 100 billion yen based on current investor commitments, according to the people, both of whom declined to be identified because the information hasn't been made public.  Investment will centre on offices and multi-family residential buildings in major cities, as well as logistics and hotels, one of the people said.

The Morgan Stanley-managed fund is due to close in June and expected to raise at least 100 billion yen based on current investor commitments, according to the people, both of whom declined to be identified because the information hasn't been made public.  Investment will centre on offices and multi-family residential buildings in major cities, as well as logistics and hotels, one of the people said.

headline: Why Morgan Stanley Stock Sank Today
summary: Shares of Morgan Stanley (NYSE: MS) fell on Thursday.  The wealth management and investment banking giant's stock lost 9.5% as of market close and was down as much as 10.4% earlier in the day.  President Donald Trump's dramatic tariff announcement has sent shockwaves through financial markets, hitting investment banks particularly hard.

headline: Stocks of Wall Street giants plunge as Trump tariff turmoil roils the finance world
summary: Stocks of the biggest banks and private-equity firms plunged Thursday as concerns mounted about how Wall Street giants and their customers might be affected by heightened odds of a US recession.

headline: We're Not Looking at Stagflation, Says Mike Wilson
summary: Mike Wilson, Morgan Stanley Chief US Equity Strategist, talks about how global markets are reacting to President Donald Trump's new tariffs and what it means for Federal Reserve monetary policy....
